title: Networks C&E NE Region Terr Director
description:
**Join our team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity:**  

The Network Services Territory Director is a seasoned leader with substantial expertise in field services and network operations, responsible for providing direction as part of the Networks Services team. This role oversees delivering excellent end-to-end operational and cost performance across the territory for all Networks services customer contracts. The person in this position will ensure high-quality work and strict adherence to safety standards while continuously managing internal outcomes and those of third-party vendors to achieve exceptional customer satisfaction, as reflected in Networks Customer scorecards. They will also maintain essential strategic relationships with customers and vendors and support vendor governance within the territory.

  

The Territory Director of Operations will supervise and manage all operational activities within the designated territory to ensure efficient and profitable service execution. This role requires strategic leadership to ensure all operations align with company objectives, customer expectations, and industry standards. The ideal candidate will possess a strong background in the telecom industry, with proven experience in operations management, strategic planning, and effective team leadership.

**What you will do**
--------------------


* **Operational Leadership**: Direct and manage all operational activities within the region, including network operations, service delivery, and offshore teams, ensuring that they are executed effectively and within the cost structure outlined in the business case.
* **Strategic Planning:** Develop and implement territory operational strategies that align with overall company objectives, driving growth and operational excellence.
* **Team Management**: Lead, mentor, and develop a high-performing team, fostering a culture of collaboration, accountability, and continuous improvement.
* **Customer Focus:** Ensure that customer satisfaction is at the forefront of all operational decisions. Implement processes to monitor and improve customer satisfaction across the territory, as defined by customer scorecards.
* **Performance Monitoring:** Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) for the territory, analyzing data to identify trends, areas for improvement, and opportunities for growth.
* **Budget Management:** Monitor territory budget and optimal internal headcount numbers based on business scope and volume, ensuring cost control while meeting operational goals and maintaining high standards of service quality.
* **Compliance and Risk Management:** Ensure all operations comply with local, state, and federal regulations, as well as company policies. Identify and mitigate risks associated with operational activities.
* **Cross-functional Collaboration:** Work closely with other organizations, such as pre-sales, NPI, NDO, and GND’s.
* **Stakeholder Management:** Build and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders, including customers and partners, ensuring alignment with company goals and objectives.
* **Vendor Management**: Prime escalation POC for supplier delivery issues and crew fulfillment, crew capacity forecasting, entry into allocation model and Supplier Information Management tool, ensuring crew demand is supplied per expected supplier mix, supplier pool vetting and selection based on scope requirements. Work hand in hand with Control Tower function to set allocation strategy with stakeholder inputs, document the allocation strategy in support of ABC compliance and ensure supplier certifications are setup in Compliance
**The skills you bring:**
-------------------------


* Bachelor’s degree, preferably in Business, Operations, Engineering, Computer Science, IT or other science discipline.
* At least 8 years of experience in the telecommunications industry.
* Extensive experience in large scale construction services with Proven technical expertise in network construction, roll-out and operations.
* Strong leadership capabilities with the ability to motivate, develop, and inspire high-performing teams.
* Well-developed understanding of contracts, scheduling, and finance/expense management.
* Track record of consistently delivering superior business results; decisive and clear thinking.
* Superior analytical and problem-solving skills; solutions-oriented; able to balance short / long-term.
* Strong understanding of telecom operations, including Construction, Integration and crew operations.
* Exceptional communication and stakeholder management skills.
* Strong negotiation and influencing skills, with advanced storytelling abilities to support in change management activities.
* Experience with digital platforms and process digitization is a plus.
* Champion Ericsson’s values and focus areas and role model our culture to foster a collaborative, respectful, and innovative team environment.
**Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**  

 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that´s why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer, learn more.


If you need assistance or to request an accommodation due to a disability, please contact Ericsson at hr.direct.mana@ericsson.com.


DISCLAIMER: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees in this position. They are not an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required for this position, and you may be required to perform additional job tasks as assigned.

**Primary country and city:** United States (US) || Morristown

**Job details:** Service Delivery Line Manager

 **Compensation and Benefits at Ericsson**  

At Ericsson, we know that our people are the key to our success. We offer a competitive package to help with your individual needs and goals.

**Your Pay**  

The salary range for this position is listed below. The actual salary offered is dependent on various factors including, but not limited to, location, the candidate’s combination of job-related knowledge, qualifications, skills, education, training, and experience.

* **LOCATION: $159,000- $209,000**

**STV:** Your pay also includes the opportunity for an annual bonus. Actual bonus payouts are based on performance of the business against the unit’s objectives, individual performance, and the individual bonus target. Certain eligibility and pro-ration rules apply.

**Your Health**  

Ericsson offers excellent health benefits including the choice of 3 medical plan options, 2 of which are PPO plans requiring employee contributions to the cost of premiums, and a High Deductible Health Plan (HDHP) with no premiums for employees and dependents. In addition, Ericsson offers free dental coverage, employee paid vision coverage, and other company paid physical wellness programs.

**Your Financial Security**  

We invest in both your short and long-term financial wellbeing. Ericsson’s 401(k) plan offers an automatic 3% company contribution and up to a 4% company match, leading to a maximum company contribution of 7% annually. Employees will also receive company paid basic life and accidental death and dismemberment coverage and paid company short-term and long-term disability benefits. Employees also have the option to participate in Ericsson’s Stock Purchase Plan.

**Your Time**  

Your work-life balance is important to us. New employees are provided up to 40 days of paid time off per year, including 15 days of accrued annual vacation, 3 personal days, 11 paid holidays, 10 sick days, and 1 volunteer day. Please note paid time off is pro-rated based on the employee’s start date. Those with additional vacation time at the end of the year may sell one week of vacation, equal to a week of pay. Furthermore, Ericsson provides up to 16 weeks of maternity/medical leave, 6 weeks of paternity or adoption leave at 100% of pay, and medical leave at 100% or 66 2/3% of pay, based on length of service.

**Additional Benefits**  

Ericsson offers many other company-paid benefits such as financial wellness programs, educational assistance, adoption assistance, matching gifts, and recognition programs.

title: Networks C&E Control Tower
description:
**About this opportunity**
--------------------------

  

The Control Tower Manager will play a pivotal role in the and-to-end delivery of regional operations in MANA Networks Construction & Engineering. This position is responsible for ensuring crew demand and resource forecasts align with operational capacity, collaborating with cross-functional teams, and driving crew productivity. The successful candidate will provide governance reporting, manage escalation processes, and support and to end services pipeline efficiency.

**What you will do:**
---------------------

 **Pipeline Management:**

* Serve as the pre-sales liaison prior to the SDP2 stage, ensuring visibility into the pre-sales pipeline for the regional operations team.

**Issue Resolution:**

* Act as the main point of contact for systemic "code red" escalations, driving resolutions to critical issues affecting operations.

**Governance Reporting:**

* Provide consistent, detailed reports on compliance metrics, including TCR readiness, allocation compliance, and demand performance.

**Safety Initiatives:**

* Lead the development and execution of safety stand-downs to uphold crew safety and operational standards.
* Review and approve or reject Job Hazard Analysis (JHA) exceptions to maintain compliance with safety guidelines.

**Strategy Optimization:**

* Identify and support strategies that enhance crew productivity, optimize allocation planning, and manage capacity effectively.

**Demand and Allocation Planning:**

* Maintain a 6–12 month demand plan aligned with Construction Unit (CU) requirements.
* Develop and ensure quarterly allocation strategies are aligned with operational goals.

**Visibility and Reporting:**

* Provide two-week crew runway visibility and ensure continuous alignment with construction pipeline needs.
* Deliver regular reports on TCR compliance, allocation strategy, and forecast accuracy.
**You will bring:**
-------------------

  




* Bachelor’s degree in Operations Management, Supply Chain, Engineering, or a related field.
* Minimum of 10 years of experience in telecom operations, crew management, or vendor management.
* Strong leadership skills with the ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management abilities.
* Proficiency in data analysis, forecasting tools, and governance reporting.
* Strategic thinker with a strong ability to drive process improvements and operational efficiency.
* Experience with demand forecasting, resource allocation, and crew management.
* Strong collaboration skills with the ability to work across cross-functional teams and vendors.
* Problem solver with a focus on mitigating risks and escalating issues when necessary.

title: Networks C&E Delivery SME
description:
**Join our team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity:**


The Networks C&E Delivery SME has a pivotal role that leads with impact, driving the success of construction, site acquisition and integration operations through effective coordination and leadership. This position serves as a dynamic expert between central teams, architects, regions, territories, and delivery teams to provide needed expertise during customer deliveries. The Delivery SME will have a direct impact on customer satisfaction, process efficiency, quality assurance, team development, and overall project success. This role requires strong leadership, communication, and problem-solving skills to deliver exceptional results and foster a productive work environment.

**What you will do:**
---------------------


* In the pre-sales phase and early phase of the project, providing input to the Customer Project Manager and/or Business Development on the level of efforts (including amount of hours) required based on the scope of the project, which will be used to develop the support the cost structure of the project

The Registered Nurse Surgical will:  

* Be a positive contributor to our collaborative nursing team
* Utilize excellent assessment skills to determine the health status of assigned patients as outlined in the Nursing Standards
* Ensure all procedures are performed based on established Standards of Care
* Administer medications and parenteral therapies in accordance with policy
* Meticulously document all aspects of patient care

  

**Requirements:**  

* Licensed as a Registered Nurse in the State of New Jersey
* BSN preferred or must be obtained within three (3) years of hire date
* BLS certification required, as approved by the American Heart Association
* ECG course completed during clinical orientation

title: Nurse Educator
description:
**Bronx Community Health Network (BCHN)**

We are seeking a dedicated Educator with a background in nursing or critical care to join our team. The ideal candidate will have experience in patient care and training development, with a passion for educating others in healthcare settings.

**Position Title**: Nurse Educator/Infection Control Coordinator

**Supervisor**: Chief Medical Officer

**Job Type:** Full-Time (37.5 hours weekly)

**Department**: Clinical Administration

**Schedule Shift**: Monday- Friday 9:00am-5:30pm and weekends as needed.

**FLSA**: Exempt

**Salary**: $95,000 -$104,000

Come join our amazing team of dedicated healthcare workers!

**Bronx Community Health Network (BCHN):** was founded in 1996 to ensure that the socio-economically depressed and medically underserved residents of the Bronx have access to high-quality and comprehensive healthcare services, Bronx Community Health Network (BCHN) is a not-for-profit, community-based organization and Federally Qualified Health Center. The organization provides a wide range of comprehensive, coordinated primary medical, oral, and mental health care and related diagnostic, pharmacy, social support, and enabling services for medically underserved/uninsured residents. BCHN’s service area includes the entire borough of the Bronx, including all 25 zip codes.

**BCHN mission**: To improve the health of people and families in the Bronx; provide access to affordable, quality health care, especially for uninsured persons; promote disease prevention, early treatment and healthful lifestyles; and obtain financial and other resources for programs and services.

**About the Role**: The Nurse Educator/Infection Control Coordinator will develop and implement infection control protocols, monitor compliance with hygiene practices, and educate healthcare staff and patients on infection prevention measures. Serve as an instructor, mentor and role model, teacher for other nursing staff and clinicians, and develop training. Evaluate students both in clinical settings and through training and assessment.

Ø Conducts an orientation program for new staff and coordinates a smooth transition into their role in partnership with direct supervisors

Ø Conducts ongoing education on infection control practices and new policies implemented within the organization

Ø Create lesson plans that accomplish predefined learning goals

Ø Teach classroom-based courses through lectures and discussions

Ø Demonstrate techniques and best practices for learners

Ø Oversee clinical practice components of nurse education and training programs

Ø Help to develop curriculum for nurse training programs in cooperation with organizational leadership

Ø Staying up to date with latest advances in medicine and changes to best practice standards for patient care

Ø Assign trainings and assessments based on the professional role of the learner

Ø Supervise nursing students or newly hired clinical support staff and provide guidance and feedback as they carry out tasks

Ø Performs other duties, as assigned.

**Qualifications and Skills**

· Bachelor’s degree (Required)

· RN License (Required)

· 3-5 years of work experience as a registered Nurse in a clinical setting

· Experience in nursing education

· Must be comfortable with basic software programs

**Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Required:**

· Extensive knowledge of nursing related to the material being

· Demonstrated communication skills necessary to explain complex medical and scientificconcepts in a manner that’s easy to understand and provide written feedback on learner’s progress.

· Well-developed interpersonal skills to engage and inspire learners.

· Create problem-solving skills to give constructive feedback and serve as a trusted advisor to clinical support staff.

· Ability to work in a group setting and exhibit strong professional acumen

Nice-to-have:  
- ICU experience  
- Anatomy knowledge  
- Previous work as a nurse in a teaching hospital  
- Background in adult education

Bronx Community Health Network is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer committed to diversity and inclusion in all aspects of recruiting and employment. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration without regard to race, color, gender, gender identity or expression, sex, sexual orientation, transgender status, gender dysphoria, national origin, age, religion, disability, military, and veteran status, martial or prenatal status, citizenship status, genetic information or any other factor which cannot lawfully be used as a basis for an employment decision.

Job Type: Full-time

* Monday to Friday

title: Controller Position
description:
**Job Title:** Controller


**Company:** The Beard Club


**Location:** New Jersey (On-Site)


**About The Beard Club:**


The Beard Club is more than just a grooming brand; we're a community of bearded legends taking the world by storm, one beard at a time. With our killer lineup of beard care products and a rapidly growing fanbase, we're shaking up the men's grooming game. We're looking for a rockstar Controller who's ready to own our finances and keep the cash flowing as smoothly as our beard oil. If you've got a sharp eye for numbers and a startup mindset, keep reading.


**Don't take this job:**


If you need to be told what to do or you can't find the answers for yourself. We're looking for someone who wants to take control of this position and make a huge impact on the business not just execute a task list.


If work-life balance is your most important job feature or you're looking to just clock in and clock out, this job is going to push your boundaries.


**Job Summary:**


Are you a financial whiz who loves juggling numbers as much as we love grooming beards? As our Controller, you'll be the financial backbone of The Beard Club, handling everything from accounting and inventory to budgeting and cash flow. We're a tight-knit team and we move fast, so we need someone who's not afraid to roll up their sleeves and dive into the next project we're focused on.


This isn't a remote gig—you'll be right here in our New Jersey HQ, rubbing elbows with the crew and making magic happen.


**Key Responsibilities:**


* Perform full monthly close of the company books in accordance with US GAAP standards.
* Prepare reports and analyses, including profitability by customer / channel / product line.
* Prepare and run weekly 13 weeks cash flow forecast
* Manage all AR, AP, and bookkeeping activities
* Manage, analyze and dispute when needed trade deductions across multiple retailers
* Prepare budget and forecast
* Manage sales tax filings
* Work with external CPA on preparing the information for the year-end tax return filing; manage the process and all communications.
* Maintain internal safeguards for revenue receipts, costs, team and organizational budgets, and actual expenditures
* Develop and enforce internal controls to maximize protection of company assets, policies, procedures, and workflows
* Implement consistent accounting policies, practices, and procedures across all programs, adhering to US GAAP standards while remaining knowledgeable of proposed legislation
* Establish (in coordination with executives) financial and operating benchmarks, budgets, program monitoring, and reporting standards on biweekly, monthly, and annual basis
* Lead the implementation of NetSuite; manage the third party implementation consultant.


**What We're Looking For**


* Minimum of 5 years of experience in accounting/finance, preferably within CPG
* Strong Understanding of banking processes and financial data analysis
* Working knowledge of national and local tax regulations and compliance reporting
* Exemplary history of financial project management
* Strong knowledge of Netsuite and QBO
* Experience with inventory management and cash flow forecasting.
* Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, startup environment with a flexible, can-do attitude.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively across teams.
* Ability to adapt and handle multiple priorities while maintaining accuracy and efficiency.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively across teams.
* Ability to adapt and handle multiple priorities while maintaining accuracy and efficiency.


**Are you Qualified?**


* Bachelor's degree in business, accounting, or related field.
* MBA or Master's in accounting is a plus
* Previous experience working in a small, high growth company


**Additional Information:**


This is an on-site position at The Beard Club's Westwood, New Jersey office.


Candidates must be willing to work in a collaborative and startup-oriented atmosphere, where teamwork and versatility are essential.


**Ready to Join the Club?**


If you're up for the challenge and ready to bring your A-game, we want to hear from you!

title: Fully Remote Account Representative
description:
Are you looking for your first or next opportunity in Sales?  

  

  

We are currently seeking enthusiastic and self-motivated individuals to join our growing team as Account Representatives on a 1099 contract basis. This is an excellent opportunity for sales professionals and entry-level candidates to kickstart their careers in sales and make a significant impact while enjoying the flexibility of working remotely.
**Responsibilities of Account Representative*** Establish and nurture relationships with clients through effective communication.

* Skillfully conveying the value propositions to potential customers.
* Contacting warm leads to move them through the sales funnel. Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of all sales activities.
  
  

  

**What's in it for You as an Account Representative at Our Organization?*** Work from the comfort of your own home, eliminating commute times and allowing for a personalized and productive workspace.

title: Medical Assistant (Part-Time)
description:
Greenwich Medical Spa (GMS) is an industry leading, award winning medical spa providing non-invasive cosmetic treatments. GMS was established in 2005 with the unwavering mission to inspire confidence and empower our patients, employees and communities.


GMS is actively seeking a **part-time**, high energy, and dedicated individual for our **Medical Assistant** position in Ridgefield. The Medical Assistant works closely with the clinician preparing patients for treatments by escorting them to their treatment room, taking photos, obtaining consents, preparing the treatment room and keeping the treatment rooms and medspa stocked with the proper supplies.

* Prepares treatment rooms and equipment at the beginning of the day and closes rooms down at the end of the day – making sure all equipment is turned off, trash is emptied, rooms are prepped for the next day.
* Verifies patient information by interviewing patient, recording medical history, and confirming purpose of visit, obtains consents for treatments.
* Prepares patients for treatments by reporting patient history summary, drawing blood (if applicable), preparing the room set up/procedure set up, cleansing, and preparing the treatment area, and any additional preparation needed for treatments.
* Obtains pre and post photography.
* Assists in confirming completion of consent and pre/post forms.
* Secures patient information and maintains patient confidence by completing and safeguarding medical record and keeping patient information confidential.
* Counsels patients by reviewing pre and post treatment care instructions.
* Maintains safe, secure, and healthy work environment by establishing and following standards and procedures and complying with all federal and state legal regulations.
* Keeps supplies ready by inventorying stock, placing orders, and verifying receipt.
* Maintains all treatment rooms by ensuring linens are clean, trash is emptied, and rooms are always impeccably clean.
* Keeps equipment operating by following operating instructions, troubleshooting breakdowns, maintaining supplies, performing preventive maintenance, and calling for repairs.
* Updates job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities and reading professional publications.
* Other duties as assigned.

**GMS** employees are passionately devoted to living our Core Values day in and day out whether we are at work or home. We go out of our way to ensure every person we hire embodies these values, therefore, we are confident these are not just actions people “turn on“ for work.


What are our **Core Values** and what do they mean?

  

* **Excellence** - *Make what you do matter*. Being the leader in your space, learning from mistakes, taking accountability, pride in work, highest quality, innovating, not being complacent. Excelling at everything you do resulting in best outcomes, quality of care and experience.
* **Integrity** - *Do the right thing*. We only ever do the right thing because there is no alternative.
* **People Focused** – All GMS is committed to building an encouraging, caring, and supportive environment for our employees and patients. We share a responsibility to support our colleagues and patients while enriching their lives. GMS is a team, through and through. We have fun, take time to support one another, and help each other to grow.
* **Passionately Driven** - *Love what you do*. A position at GMS is not just a job – it is a passion, it is an experience.
* **Respect** - *Everyone*. Our staff sees people as people, first and foremost and they respect everyone for their humanity. We hold no judgement and we honor everyone we encounter.
* **Growth** - *Embracing change*. Personal growth, professional growth, service offerings. Being fluid and flexible, adaptable, open minded.

title: Corporate Receptionist
description:
The **Corporate Receptionist** is the professional and energetic first impression of the company's corporate reception desk and office. The ideal candidate will perform reception/administrative duties and provide organizational support for multiple departments in the corporate office. Responsible for managing visitors, telephone calls, and messages professionally and efficiently, and effectively performing clerical duties that support corporate operations.


**Essential Tasks**


* Promptly, accurately, professionally, and courteously answer all phone calls, take accurate messages, screen and direct calls to the appropriate department on a multi-line phone system.


* Greet and professionally screen incoming visitors and promptly notify appropriate personnel of their arrival.


* Receive, sort, and distribute incoming mail and prepare outgoing mail promptly.


* Receive and sign for courier deliveries and distribute to appropriate personnel.


* Properly address and prepare certified/overnight/return receipt mail.


* Inventory and stock office supplies and miscellaneous items as directed.


* Operate standard office equipment and peripheral devices – copier, printer, scanner, PC, etc.


* Keep the printing area, supply/storage rooms, conference rooms, breakrooms, refrigerators, and reception area organized and clean.


* *Handles all sensitive material with the highest degree of confidentiality.*


* Retrieve nightly voice mail and direct it to appropriate personnel during the following business day.


* Maintain an organized office calendar and schedule meetings and appointments as needed.


**Job Requirements:**


2 years of receptionist/administrative support experience, excellent interpersonal skills, self-manageable, enthusiasm, entry-level MS Office experience.

title: Manny Needed in Park Slope
description:
**Job#2453**
------------


**MVP Manny\\* Needed**
----------------------


**Job Title:** Full-Time Manny (Male Nanny) for Active Boys


**Location:** Brooklyn (Park Slope) NY


**Start Date:** Flexible, ideally before September 5, 2024 (school start date)


**Schedule:**


* Minimum: Monday through Thursday, after-school hours
* Full position: Approximately 30 hours per week, with flexibility


**Compensation:** $35 hour


**Position Overview:** We are seeking an energetic, creative, and dedicated Manny to care for our two boys, ages 11 and 13 (6th and 8th grade). The ideal candidate will provide after-school care, support their academic and extracurricular activities, and contribute to overall household management. This role requires someone who can maintain a consistent routine, encourage physical activity, and adapt to the unique learning styles of each child.


**Primary Responsibilities:**


* Provide after-school care and supervision for two boys
* Maintain and encourage daily routines, including physical activities
* Support and facilitate participation in travel soccer and other extracurricular activities
* Assist with homework and academic support, adapting to individual learning differences
* Implement creative organization and motivation strategies
* Use positive reinforcement techniques to encourage good behavior and personal growth


**Additional Tasks:**


* Meal preparation for the children
* Managing kids' laundry
* General house management and organization
* Running errands and shopping as needed
* Building and maintaining home organizational systems


**Desired Qualities:**


* Mindful and patient approach to childcare
* Creativity in problem-solving and activity planning
* Enthusiasm for exploring different methods of organization and motivation
* Strong focus on positive reinforcement techniques
* Ability to manage occasional challenging behaviors, especially related to physical stimulation
* Interest in sports, particularly soccer
* Adaptability and flexibility in daily routines
* Strong communication skills with both children and parents


**Requirements:**


* Proven experience in childcare, preferably with pre-teens and teenagers
* Background in social work, education, or related field preferred
* Understanding of learning differences and adaptive teaching methods
* Physical ability to engage in active play and sports with the children
* Valid driver's license and clean driving record
* CPR and First Aid certifications (or willingness to obtain)
* Excellent references and willingness to undergo a background check

**Additional Information:**


* This position offers long-term potential for the right candidate
* We are committed to finding the perfect fit for our family and are open to adjusting terms for the ideal Manny


Qualified candidates are encouraged to apply with a resume and a brief statement explaining their interest in and qualifications for this unique Manny position. We look forward to meeting energetic and compassionate individuals who can make a positive impact on our boys' lives and their household.

* What Is A Bona Fide Occupational Qualification (BFOQ)


In cases where we specify male caregivers, this requirement can be considered a Bona Fide Occupational Qualification (BFOQ). This means that the characteristic (being male) is reasonably necessary to the normal operation of the particular family situation and the specific needs of the child.

title: Aircraft and Facility Detailer- Part time on Call
description:
Foxtrot Aviation Services is looking for dedicated, energetic, quality and safety focused individuals to join our ever-growing family!


Foxtrot provides members of the aviation industry with top-of-the-line aircraft detailing, line service and facility cleaning services. We service a wide variety of aircraft and facilities both large and small! This position is based out of **Teterboro Airport (TEB) and Westchester County Airport (HPN)** **,** our company is continually growing, and we need candidates who meet and exceed our expectations of becoming the nation's leading aircraft detailing and facility support company!


Any applicants who are interested in learning more about Foxtrot Aviation Services and the opportunities available are encouraged to visit our career site here! —> Openings at Foxtrot Aviation Services (breezy.hr) (https://foxtrot-aviation-services.breezy.hr/)


**Job Description****: Part time on call shif****ts vary hours Monday-Friday 10:00 am -5:00 pm, Saturday and Sunday 5:00 pm - 10:00 pm** aircraft and facility cleaning. Applicants are asked to have open and flexible availability to work both nights and weekends.


* You will be responsible for the cleaning and detailing of our customer's facility and aircraft!
* Aircraft interior services include but are not limited to the cleaning and disinfection of the galley, cockpit, seating areas, carpet, as well as the lavatories.
* Aircraft exterior services include but are not limited to detailing the exterior of the aircraft, wiping, buffing and much more!
* Facility cleanings include janitorial work such as mopping, buffing, sweeping, wiping, and disinfecting windows and servicing the bathrooms (this includes the cleaning of toilets, flooring, and sinks).


**Job Title:** Aircraft Detailer and Facility Cleaner


**Employment Type:** **Part Time on Call**


**Pay:** $21.00 per hour


**Benefits:** Medical, Life, Dental, 401(k) with a generous company match (our 401k program is available to both Part-Time and Full-Time employees), and PTO to qualifying Full-Time employees.


**Requirements:**


* Must be able to pass a 10-year background check and obtain airport badging.
* Must be able to pass a drug test (this includes the recreational use of Marijuana)
* Possess a valid driver's license and have reliable transportation.
* Capable of bending, twisting, lifting and using machinery such as buffers for extended periods of time.
* Perform general manual labor.
* Be comfortable working with heights.
* Open availability and flexibility with scheduling.
* Veterans must provide the form DD214 of discharge information if applicable.


**Qualifications:**


* We are looking for people who are *dependable!*
* We are looking for people who are *energetic!*
* We are looking for people who *take pride in their work!*
* We are looking for people who are *quality focused!*
* We are looking for people who *embody our core values* of accountability, GRIT, Safety, Client Focus and Solidarity!


**Why work at Foxtrot Aviatio****n Services?**


Here at Foxtrot, we care just as much about the professional development of our employees as we do creating a welcoming environment. Foxtrot Aviation is an exciting, fast paced, and growing company! There are plenty of opportunities for performance-based pay raises with full compliance of company policies and performance reviews and personal professional development!


At Foxtrot Aviation Services the SKY is the limit, jump start your career and **APPLY TODAY!**

title: Registered Nurse (RN)
description:
**Position Title**: Registered Nurse (RN)

**Supervisor**: Chief Medical Officer

**Job Type:** Full-Time (37.5 hours weekly)

**Department**: Clinical Administration

**Schedule Shift**: Monday- Friday 9:00am-5:30pm and weekends as needed.

**FLSA**: Exempt

**Salary**: $80,000 - $90,000

Come join our amazing team of dedicated healthcare workers!

We are seeking a dedicated Registered Nurse to join our healthcare team. The ideal candidate will have a passion for providing high-quality patient care and possess a diverse skill set to excel in various medical settings.

**Bronx Community Health Network (BCHN)** was founded in 1996 to ensure that the socio-economically depressed and medically underserved residents of the Bronx have access to high quality and comprehensive health care services, Bronx Community Health Network (BCHN) is a not-for-profit, community-based organization and Federally Qualified Health Center. The organization provides a wide range of comprehensive, coordinated primary medical, oral, mental health care and related diagnostic, pharmacy, social support and enabling services for medically underserved/uninsured residents. BCHN’s service area includes the entire borough of the Bronx, including all 25 zip codes.

**BCHN mission**: To improve the health of people and families in the Bronx; provide access to affordable, quality health care, especially for uninsured persons; promote disease prevention, early treatment and healthful lifestyles; and obtain financial and other resources for programs and services.

BCHN is seeking a full-time Registered Nurse who will be a key member of the health care team covering different centers, providing support to health providers in addressing the health care needs of patients. The ideal candidate will be responsible for working with other healthcare professionals to help treat patients with various injuries, illnesses, or disabilities.

**About the Role**: The Registered Nurse (RN) is responsible for providing care to patients within the center as directed by the medical staff. Their duties include communicating with doctors and other Registered Nurses about patient needs, administering immunizations and medications appropriate and using medical equipment to monitor patient’s vital signs and perform point of care testing as indicated.

Ø Observe and record patient behavior.

Ø Perform patient assessments and diagnostic tests.

Ø Collect patient health history and triage acutely ill patients.

Ø Counsel and educate patients and their families on treatment plans.

Ø Provide patient education for chronic disease self-management.

Ø Administer medication, change wound dressings, and provide self-care instruction.

Ø Read and interpret patient information, making treatment decisions when appropriate.

Ø Consult with supervisors and doctors to decide on the best treatment plan for patients.

Ø Direct and supervise nurses, medical assistants.

Ø Participate in QI projects to improve healthcare processes and improve patient outcomes.

Ø Maintains nursing competence through participation in continuing professional education and other appropriate learning experience.

Ø Performs other duties, as assigned.

· Experience 1-4 years as an RN

· Bachelor’s Degree (Required).

· RN License (Current New York State License Required)

· Bilingual English & Spanish (Preferred)

· Good computer skills

· Good time management and organization

· Able to analyze, review and judge different situations and take the right actions according to the situation.

· Ability to walk and stand for long periods of time; ability to lift and move patients.

title: Operations Assistant
description:
**Position Details**
--------------------


Position Information
**Recruitment/Posting Title** Operations Assistant
  

**Posting Number** 24TM0325
  

**Department** Operations
  

**Overview**
The Division of Continuing Studies (DoCS) is the central continuing education unit at Rutgers University. DoCS is a university-wide division at Rutgers University that includes over 125 employees in 14 distinct units at over a dozen locations, that coordinate hundreds of credit and non-credit programs, enrolling thousands of participants, reaching audiences from youth to retirees and providing various support services across the University. Our educational services include a range of services that rely on state-of-the-art technologies.  

Information Technology at Continuing Studies, a unit of the Division of Continuing Studies, provides comprehensive IT solutions for university continuing studies units and university academic departments.
  

**Posting Summary**
Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey is seeking an Operations Assistant for The Division of Continuing Studies Operations.  

  

Among the key duties of the position are the following:* Ensures that instructional facilities meet the specific needs of instructors, participants, and DoCS staff.
* Implements room setup and breakdown according to the instructional team’s requirements and ensures the reserved space is cleaned after each program.
* Removes trash and cleans surfaces to prepare the facility for the next scheduled program in the absence of custodial services.
* Assists with essential building maintenance needs.
* Proactively identifies and troubleshoots maintenance concerns and works with the Operations team on pending facility needs.
* Serves as the on-site AV coordinator (Level 1 support) and develops operational-level proficiency with AV hardware and systems in the facility.
* Arrives at least 30 minutes before the earliest participant arrival time, including scheduled office hours or pre-class activities.
* Develops proficiency in operational-level emergency procedures and reports responsibilities. This may include responding to fire emergencies, weather disasters, active shooter situations, medical emergencies, etc.
* Solves routine and non-routine program needs for students, instructors, and guests.
* Maintains a professional, friendly, and flexible demeanor when representing DoCS.
* Performs other duties as assigned by management.

**FLSA** Nonexempt

Qualifications

* High School diploma or equivalent, and/or up to 4 years of relevant office, clerical, bookkeeping, library assistant or related experience.


  

**Certifications/Licenses**
* A valid driver’s license would be required for this position; Use of personal vehicle in order to travel for business demands.


  

**Preferred Qualifications**
* Strong organizational skills.
* Customer-focused mindset.

**Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities**
  

**Equipment Utilized**

* Ability to stand, walk, and bend for extended durations during program hours.

Position Information
**Recruitment/Posting Title** Office Assistant
  

**Posting Number** 24TM0309
  

**Department** SAS - English Writing Program
  

**Overview**
The School of Arts and Sciences (SAS) is the largest academic unit at Rutgers University and the center of the undergraduate experience on the Rutgers–New Brunswick campus and is comprised of 41 academic departments spanning the liberal arts.  

SAS offers more than 100 majors and minors across the life sciences, humanities, social and behavioral sciences, and mathematical and physical sciences with research centers and institutes across the school. With a diverse student body of more than 20,000 students, SAS has a membership of over 1,700 faculty members, more than 500 administrative staff, and 200,000 living alumni.  

SAS delivers a wide array of services in support of the teaching, research, and the mission and goals of Rutgers University.
  

The School of Arts and Sciences promotes anti-racist, inclusive, equity-enhancing ideas and practices both inside and outside of the classroom for our community of educators, staff, and students. This includes a diverse set of voices and experiences. All individuals no matter their race, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, nationality, history, sexual orientation, religious practices, or socio-economic status are valued and respected. The School of Arts and Sciences is especially interested in candidates who can contribute to and support the diversity and excellence of the organization. Applicants are encouraged to include in their cover letter information about how they will further our commitment to these values.
  

**Posting Summary**
Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey, is seeking an Office Assistant for the English Writing Program department within the School of Arts & Sciences. Under the general guidance of the Writing Program (including all affiliated units) administrative staff, Business Manager Supervisor, Director of Finance & Operations, and Faculty Leadership, the Office Assistant performs business, administrative and secretarial duties.  

Among the key duties of this position are the following:* Supports daily administrative operations of the Writing Program and affiliated units including but not limited to assisting in maintaining office equipment and supplies, unlocking and locking department offices and space, and liaising with federal work-study student workers on different administrative activities.

**Overview**
The Division of Institutional Planning & Operations (IP&O) employs a workforce of approximately 2,700 staff, represented by 15 collective negotiations agreements, and is responsible for institutional strategic initiatives and operations, which encompasses an expansive range of comprehensive service and business operations across the State of New Jersey. These include planning and construction, facilities, public safety and emergency operations, environmental health and safety, transportation, housing, and auxiliary/retail operations.

Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey, is seeking a Environmental Svc Worker PT for the Division of Institutional Planning & Operations (IP&O). The primary purpose of the Environmental Services worker is to perform various tasks to maintain a clean, safe, sanitary an attractive environment.

* Performs routine and general cleaning to prevent the spread of infection and keeps areas orderly and attractive.

title: Mobile Health Unit Driver, PD
description:
**Position Details**
--------------------


Position Information
**Recruitment/Posting Title** Mobile Health Unit Driver, PD
  

**Job Category** Staff & Executive
  

**Department** Epi-Cancer Health Disparity
  

**Overview**
Through our science, our evidence-based actions, our openness, and our respect for those we serve, we will advance cancer-focused research worldwide and reduce the burden of cancer in our catchment area. By engaging with and empowering our exceptionally diverse populations, and addressing their questions and fears, we will engender hope for cancer patients and their families and play a critical role in strengthening the fabric of our communities by gaining and protecting their trust and providing access to the outstanding oncology care each person deserves.
Our mission is to accelerate scientific discovery focused on understanding cancer, innovating cancer treatment, and improving cancer prevention; to provide outstanding, novel, and compassionate patient care; to provide evidence-based and culturally informed education to physicians, nurses, researchers, staff, and the community; and to achieve cancer health equity in our state through outreach to and engagement of our extraordinarily diverse communities.
Curiosity and Discovery, Integrity, Collaboration, Cultivating Diversity, Respect and Caring, Perseverance.
  

**Posting Summary**
Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey is seeking a Mobile Health Unit Driver within the Rutgers Cancer Institute of New Jersey.  

  

The Mobile Health Unit Driver supports the improvement of patient outcomes through implementation of mobile health services for cancer screening at Screen NJ partner sites throughout New Jersey. The focus of the Screen NJ program is prevention and early detection of cancer. The Mobile Health Unit Driver is a member of the Mobile Health Unit Team responsible for the safe functioning and operation of the mobile unit and thus supports the extension of health services to medically underserved residents across New Jersey.  

  

Among the key duties for this position are the following:* Drives a large (38’ long) Mobile Medical Unit in a safe, responsible manner, ensuring the MMU is setup and ready prior to clinical team arriving. Ensures MMU is mechanically sound and is adequately fueled, completing pre and post inspections before and after each use. Promptly reports any adverse mechanical, unsafe or unkempt conditions of vehicle.
* Ensures that medical mobile units are able to be driven safely, able to complete basic maintenance procedures for operation including vehicle refueling, generator operation, climate control operation, dumping waste, leveling jacks, maintenance checks, cleaning, supply purchasing, washing, etc.
* Performs a wide variety of clerical tasks as directed by clinical staff including but not limited to patient registration, updating demographic information in patient medical records, completion of new patient paperwork and other grant paperwork, and other non-clinical duties as assigned.
* Stocks all required supplies and forms, conducts routine equipment and maintenance checks on the mobile medical unit. Responsible for medical mobile unit care and upkeep including general cleaning and daily routine maintenance.
* Exhibits tact and a helpful attitude towards medical mobile unit staff, on site personnel, clients and demonstrates good communication and listening skills with staff and clients.
* Promotes teamwork and actively participates in meetings.
* Able to work closely with staff at client sites and other community-based organizations and willing to engage with patients to promote interest and access to medical, dental, behavioral health, nutrition, case management, and insurance enrollment services.
* Adheres to clinic departmental policies and procedures, which include Joint Commission (JC) standards, Patient Safety initiatives, Patient Rights, and Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) Privacy standards.

  

**Position Status** Per Diem
  

**Hours Per Week** 20
  

**Daily Work Shift**
  

**Work Arrangement**
Consistent with the current application of Rutgers Policy 60.3.22, this position may be eligible for a hybrid work arrangement. The flexible work arrangements outlined in Rutgers Policy 60.3.22 are part of a pilot program that is effective September 1, 2022 through August 31, 2024. Therefore, there is no guarantee that this flexible work arrangement will continue beyond that date. Flexible work arrangements are not permanent, are subject to change or cancellation and contingent on the employee receiving approval in the FlexWork@RU Application System. Additional information may be found at **https://futureofwork.rutgers.edu**.

* High School Diploma or equivalent.

**Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities**
* Must possess strong verbal and written skills to communicate effectively with the staff, patients, and community partners.
* Ability to work collaboratively with physicians (or other professionals involved in specialized service provision for patients/clients), staff, and external organizations.
* Strong communication skills with diverse populations.
* Solid relationship-building and interpersonal skills.
* Excellent time management skills.
* Excellent coordination skills, including multitasking and setting priorities on work assignments.

title: Research Support Associate
description:
**Position Details**
--------------------


Position Information
**Recruitment/Posting Title** Research Support Associate
  

**Job Category** Staff & Executive - Research Support (Laboratory/Non-Laboratory)
  

**Department** RSDM-Restorative Dentistry
  

**Overview**
The Biomaterials Research Lab (BRL) at Rutgers University is recognized as one of the most productive research laboratories in its field, boasting an impressive record of more than 50 scholarly publications in recent years. Dedicated to transforming oral health care, BRL is committed to making significant advancements not only within New Jersey but also on a national scale. This commitment is driven by a passion for innovation, excellence in education, groundbreaking discoveries, and a focus on patient and family-centered care. Moreover, BRL is deeply invested in addressing the health needs of our diverse community, ensuring that its research and developments are inclusive and beneficial for all. Equipped with the most powerful and cutting-edge tools available in dental research, such as the Scanning Electron Microscope, BRL stands at the forefront of technological advancement in the field. This state-of-the-art equipment allows the lab to conduct in-depth studies and develop innovative solutions to complex dental health challenges. At the heart of BRL’s success is a team of dedicated researchers and clinicians who share a vision for a healthier future. Through their relentless pursuit of excellence and their commitment to improving lives through dental health innovation, BRL continues to lead the way in biomaterials research.
  

**Posting Summary**
Rutgers School of Dental Medicine (RSDM) seeks a passionate and committed Research Support Associate for its Biomaterials Research Lab (BRL) in the Department of Restorative Dentistry, led by Dr. MA Saghiri, PhD. BRL is a leader in dental research, focusing on dentin structure, the impact of systemic diseases like diabetes on dentin quality, and the development of innovative, expandable biomaterials to restore dentin. The RSA will play a key role in research projects, from planning to execution, including data collection, analysis, and sharing results. This role also involves mentoring and teaching, contributing to the education of future dental professionals. Candidates should have a strong interest in dental science and biomaterials research, with a dedication to research excellence and education. This position offers a collaborative environment to contribute to advancing dental medicine and patient care.  

  

Among the key duties of this position are the following:
* **Research Design and Execution:**
	+ Collaborate with lab director and team members to design research protocols and experiments focused on understanding the structure of dentin, effects of systemic diseases on dentin quality, and the development of innovative biomaterials.
	+ Execute detailed experimental procedures with precision, maintaining high standards of scientific rigor and data integrity.
* **Data Analysis and Management:**
	+ Perform comprehensive data analysis using appropriate statistical and computational tools to interpret results from experiments.
	+ Maintain accurate and organized records of research data, ensuring accessibility for further analysis and review.
* **Grant and Manuscript Preparation:**
	+ Assist in drafting grant proposals, including developing research objectives, methodologies, and budgets to secure funding for future projects.
	+ Contribute to the writing and editing of manuscripts for publication in peer-reviewed journals, ensuring clarity, coherence, and compliance with journal guidelines.
* **Laboratory Operations and Compliance:**
	+ Support the maintenance of laboratory equipment and the ordering of supplies to ensure the smooth operation of research activities.
	+ Adhere to all safety and compliance protocols, including ethical guidelines for research involving human or animal subjects.
* **Collaboration and Communication:**
	+ Engage in collaborative research efforts within and outside the department, contributing to interdisciplinary projects and knowledge exchange.
	+ Communicate effectively with lab members, faculty, and external partners to facilitate progress on research objectives and dissemination of findings.
* **Professional Development** Stay updated on the latest research and developments in dental biomaterials and related fields through literature review, workshops, and conferences. Participate in training sessions and seminars to enhance technical skills and research methodologies.


* Performs other duties as assigned.



  

**Position Status** Full Time
  

**Hours Per Week**
  

**Daily Work Shift**
  

**Work Arrangement**
This position requires a fully on-site work arrangement.
  

**FLSA** Nonexempt
  

**Grade** 99S
  

**Position Salary** $49,000
  

**Annual Minimum Salary** 00.00
  

**Annual Mid Range Salary** 0.00
  

**Annual Maximum Salary** 0.00
  

**Standard Hours** 40.00
  

**Union Description** Short-Term Assignments
  

**Payroll Designation** PeopleSoft
  

**Benefits**
Rutgers offers a comprehensive benefit program to eligible employees. For details, please go to **http://uhr.rutgers.edu/benefits/benefits-overview**.  

  

**Seniority Unit**
  

**Terms of Appointment** Staff - 12 month
  

**Position Pension Eligibility** None
  

Qualifications
**Minimum Education and Experience**
* A Bachelor’s Degree in a relevant science with at least three years of related research experience (which may include relevant research performed as part of college coursework).
* Relevant Sciences include Neuroscience, Psychological/Cognitive Science, Social Work and Biological Science.
* Experience with data analysis, data management or computer coding may also be counted as related research experience.


  

**Certifications/Licenses**
  

**Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities**
* Strong analytical skills, with experience in data analysis, data management, and potentially computer coding, as applicable to research in dental biomaterials or related scientific inquiries.
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, necessary for effective collaboration across multiple departments and interactions with research participants, including those who may have neuropsychiatric problems.
* The ability to work empathetically and professionally with a diverse range of participants is essential.
* Demonstrated ability to work independently and as part of a team, with a strong commitment to contributing to interdisciplinary research efforts.
* Flexibility and adaptability to meet the changing needs and priorities of research projects and the lab environment.
* A commitment to ethical research practices and a thorough understanding of compliance and safety protocols relevant to the field.


  

**Preferred Qualifications**
* A Master’s degree or a Doctor of Dental Surgery (DDS) degree from an accredited institution in a relevant field of study. Relevant fields include, but are not limited to, Dental Sciences, Biomaterials, Dental materials, Computer Engineering, Material Science.
* A minimum of 3 years of related research experience post-graduation. This experience should demonstrate a solid foundation in experimental design, data collection, and analysis within the context of dental sciences or closely related fields.
* Experience in managing and conducting research projects, including familiarity with laboratory procedures, data analysis software, and research methodologies pertinent to the field of dental biomaterials or similar areas.
* A track record of contributing to the scientific community, evidenced by at least 3 publications in peer-reviewed journals. These publications should ideally be related to dental science, biomaterials research, or other relevant fields, showcasing the candidate’s ability to conduct meaningful research and disseminate findings effectively.


  

**Equipment Utilized**
  

**Physical Demands and Work Environment**
* Standing, sitting, walking, talking, or hearing.
* No special vision requirements.
* Must be able to lift or exert up to 25 pounds.
* Office environment. Moderate noise.


  

**Special Conditions**

title: Certified Dental Assistant
description:
**Position Details**
--------------------


Position Information
**Recruitment/Posting Title** Certified Dental Assistant
  

**Job Category** Staff & Executive - Allied Health - Dental Assisting
  

**Department** RSDM-Restorative Dentistry
  

**Overview**
New Jersey’s academic health center, Rutgers Biomedical and Health Sciences (RBHS) takes an integrated approach to educating students, providing clinical care, and conducting research, all with the goal of improving human health. Aligned with Rutgers University–New Brunswick and collaborating university wide, RBHS includes eight schools, a behavioral health network, and five centers and institutes that focus on cancer treatment and research, neuroscience, advanced biotechnology and medicine, environmental and occupational health, and health care policy and aging research.
Our faculty are teachers, clinicians, and scientists with unparalleled experience who advance medical innovation and provide patient care informed by the latest research findings. We offer an outstanding education in medicine, dentistry, pharmacy, public health, nursing, biomedical research, and the full spectrum of allied health careers.
Our clinical and academic facilities are located throughout the state—at Rutgers University–New Brunswick, including Piscataway; and at locations in Newark, Scotch Plains, Somerset, Stratford, and other locations. Clinical partners include Robert Wood Johnson University Hospital in New Brunswick, Newark’s University Hospital in Newark, and other affiliates.
Through this community of healers, scientists, and scholars, Rutgers is equipped as never before to transform lives.
  

**Posting Summary**
Rutgers School of Dental Medicine (RSDM) is seeking a Certified Dental Assistant for the Department of Restorative Dentistry. This position will perform chair side and desk side duties within the Prosthodontics Postgraduate Program clinic. The person will assist during examination and treatment of patients and dispense dental materials and instruments. The Dental Assistant performs clerical, sterilizing and miscellaneous tasks for the program and serves as dispensary clerk on an as needed basis.  

  

Among the key duties of this position are the following:* Takes, develops and mounts x-rays; maintains x-ray solutions and developer along with the maintenance of x-ray cleaning log.
* Charts examination under the direction of the doctor.
* Assists in implant procedures.
* Maintains inventory of implant components.
* Serves as backup sterilization assistant, cleans ultrasonic units as needed.
* Prepares clinical kits for students.
* Cleans up all discharged bodily fluid immediately.
* Prepares unit for provider and patient.
* Sets and drapes the patient to prepare for treatment.
* Performs other related duties as assigned.

All offers of employment are contingent upon successful completion of all pre-employment screenings.
Immunization Requirements
Under Policy 100.3.1 Immunization Policy for Covered Individuals, if employment will commence during Flu Season, Rutgers University may require certain prospective employees to provide proof that they are vaccinated against Seasonal Influenza for the current Flu Season, unless the University has granted the individual a medical or religious exemption. Additional infection control and safety policies may apply. Prospective employees should speak with their hiring manager to determine which policies apply to the role or position for which they are applying. Failure to provide proof of vaccination for any required vaccines or obtain a medical or religious exemption from the University will result in rescission of a candidate’s offer of employment or disciplinary action up to and including termination.
